page.title: 03FARMING IN BALLYUTOAG
page.content:
The dairy farmers also grow fields of grass which they use to make silage and hay. They use the silage for winter fodder. The hay is kept as fodder and bedding for calves born during the winter.
The beef cattle in the area are Charolais and Aberdeen. The farmers send their animals to Belfast for slaughter.
All of the farms are well provided for with sheds and outbuildings. Every farm had at least one car plus tractors and other farm machinery.
The largest farm in the area is { {Aughnabrack House. }
